Hi,

Thank you so much for your answer. I used the
commandline that you give me, but i think the output
from commandline are not correct with my requirement.
I would like to get link structure of the crawled URIs
to use for "link analysis". I need this informations
because i would like to compare with other crawlers. 

For example with nutch carwler(http://www.nutch.org/).
I can get informations about links from
nutch(net.nutch.db.WebDBReader).
The informations about crawled pages are:

Page 1: Version: 4
URL:
http://www.learninglab.de/~brunkhor/javadoc/jena/com/hp/hpl/jena/vocabulary/RDFS.Nodes.html
ID: 000964db178cd1c7af9b20f21c62e612
Next fetch: Mon Dec 27 05:24:50 CET 2004
Retries since fetch: 0
Retry interval: 30 days
Num outlinks: 14
Score: 1.0
NextScore: 1.0

URL:
http://www.learninglab.de/~brunkhor/javadoc/j2sdk1.4.2/java/rmi/Naming.html
ID: 000ac1fa6dac5cfb0c7f1b682c40ea82
Next fetch: Mon Dec 27 05:24:50 CET 2004
Retries since fetch: 0

Num outlinks: 22

....
and the information about link structure:

from
http://www.learninglab.de/~brunkhor/javadoc/jena/com/hp/hpl/jena/vocabulary/RDFS.Nodes.html
 to
http://www.learninglab.de/~brunkhor/javadoc/j2sdk1.4.2/java/lang/Object.html
 to ... #show all 14 outlinks 

from
http://www.learninglab.de/~brunkhor/javadoc/j2sdk1.4.2/java/rmi/Naming.html
 to
http://www.learninglab.de/~brunkhor/javadoc/j2sdk1.4.2/allclasses-noframe.html
 to ... #show all 22 outlinks

from
http://www.learninglab.de/~brunkhor/javadoc/j2sdk1.4.2/javax/swing/text/Utilities.html
 to
http://www.learninglab.de/~brunkhor/javadoc/j2sdk1.4.2/allclasses-noframe.html
 to ... #show all 20 outlinks
....

I need the information like that for analyzing
links.Can you suggest me how i can get some
information like that from Heritrix(maybe from
crawl.log or other way).

Regards and Thank you so much,
Niti 




--- Igor Ranitovic <igor@...> wrote:

>  From crawl.log you can get this information with a
> bit of perl and unix commandline.
> For example:
> 
> cat crawl.log | tr -s " " | cut -f4,6 -d " " | sort
> -k2,2 | perl -ane 'BEGIN{$uri="";}; if (!$uri) { 
> print "from: $F[1]\n to: $F[0]\n";}; if ($uri &&
> $uri !~ $F[1]){print "from: $F[1]\n to: $F[0]\n"} 
> else {print " to $F[0]\n";}; $uri =$F[1];'
> 
> Lets us know if this is what you are looking for.
> 
> i.
> 
> 
> > Niti Witthayawiroj wrote:
> > 
> > 
> >>Hallo All,
> >>
> >>I used Heritrix to crawl some hosts and my crawl
> job
> >>is finished. I would like to get the links
> structure
> >>of pages that are carwled. Can you tell me about
> the
> >>format of the links structure and How i can get
> it.
> >>
> >>For example: the format of links structure(or
> other
> >>format, may be links with pageId)
> >>
> >>from http://a.com/a.html
> >>to http://a.com/b.html
> >>to http://a.com/c.html
> >>
> >>from http://a.com/b.html
> >>to http://a.com/a.html
> >>to http://a.com/c.html
> >>...
> > 
> > 
> > We don't have publically-available tools currently
> that will allow you 
> > to extract document links post crawl.  We have to
> add them. We currently 
> > use proprietary tools here at the Archive for
> doing this but intend to 
> > move off them with time. 
> > 
> > We have various ideas for how to implement the
> link extraction tools -- 
> > usually based off some rerunning of the Heritrix
> extractors against the 
> > downloaded ARCs -- but we just haven't gotten
> around to it yet.  There's 
> > also a feature request to drop links found in a
> page as we crawl.
> > 
> > The crawl.log will list how a page was discovered.
> > 
> > St.Ack
> > 
> > 
> > 
> >>Thank so much
> >>Niti
> >>
> >>
